sect1.title: Synopsis
sect1.para: Define properties for the tool, which can be used as parameters later in all scripts and can be configured when a workflow is set up.

sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Properties are a means to let the user of the integrated tool configure some attributes when creating a workflow. For example, if your tool is able to run with multiple cores, you can define a key “numCores” and later add it as placeholder in your command execution script or pre/post execution script (e.g. “tool.exe ${prop:numCores}”). This key will then be shown in the properties tab in the workflow editor and the value for it can be defined there.
Properties have a display name that makes them more readable for others. Also, a default value can be defined, to provide some useful presettings.
It is not mandatory to define properties.

sect1.title: Groups
sect1.para: With groups you can categorize the properties and group properties for the same context. It is also possible to create a file for each group at runtime, which contains the keys and the respective values. These files will be located in the “Config” folder in a temporary directory with the name that you can also define here.
